content: Created a Makefile with `run` and `test` targets that (via `tee` and `outputs/` auto-creation) always write `outputs/run.log` and `outputs/test.log` each cycle while executing configurable `RUN_CMD`/`TEST_CMD`.

output.code:
from pathlib import Path, PurePosixPath
base=Path("/mnt/data")
sorted([p.name for p in base.iterdir()])[:50]

from pathlib import Path
import json

target_path = Path('/mnt/data').joinpath('Makefile')
target_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)

chunks = [
"""# Makefile
# Purpose: Provide standard `make run` and `make test` targets that ALWAYS
# write logs to outputs/run.log and outputs/test.log (mandatory cycle artifacts).

SHELL := /usr/bin/env bash
.SHELLFLAGS := -eu -o pipefail -c

# Override these as needed, e.g.:
#   make run RUN_CMD="python -m your_module"
#   make test TEST_CMD="python -m pytest -q"
RUN_CMD ?= python -m generated_script_1766543295064
TEST_CMD ?= python -m pytest -q

OUTPUTS_DIR := outputs
RUN_LOG := $(OUTPUTS_DIR)/run.log
TEST_LOG := $(OUTPUTS_DIR)/test.log

.PHONY: help run test clean-logs

help:
\t@printf "%s\\n" \\
\t  "Targets:" \\
\t  "  make run   - run the project; writes $(RUN_LOG)" \\
\t  "  make test  - run tests; writes $(TEST_LOG)" \\
\t  "" \\
\t  "Variables (override on CLI):" \\
\t  "  RUN_CMD=...   (default: $(RUN_CMD))" \\
\t  "  TEST_CMD=...  (default: $(TEST_CMD))"

$(OUTPUTS_DIR):
\t@mkdir -p "$(OUTPUTS_DIR)"

run: $(OUTPUTS_DIR)
\t@echo "=== make run @ $$(date -Iseconds) ===" | tee "$(RUN_LOG)"
\t@echo "RUN_CMD: $(RUN_CMD)" | tee -a "$(RUN_LOG)"
\t@{ $(RUN_CMD); } 2>&1 | tee -a "$(RUN_LOG)"

test: $(OUTPUTS_DIR)
\t@echo "=== make test @ $$(date -Iseconds) ===" | tee "$(TEST_LOG)"
\t@echo "TEST_CMD: $(TEST_CMD)" | tee -a "$(TEST_LOG)"
\t@{ $(TEST_CMD); } 2>&1 | tee -a "$(TEST_LOG)"

clean-logs:
\t@rm -f "$(RUN_LOG)" "$(TEST_LOG)"
"""
]

final_text = '\n'.join(block.strip('\n') for block in chunks).strip() + '\n'
target_path.write_text(final_text, encoding='utf-8')

print('FILE_WRITTEN:Makefile')
print('DIR_STATE:' + json.dumps(sorted(str(p.relative_to(Path("/mnt/data"))) for p in target_path.parent.glob('*') if p.is_file())))

content.text: Created a Makefile with `run` and `test` targets that (via `tee` and `outputs/` auto-creation) always write `outputs/run.log` and `outputs/test.log` each cycle while executing configurable `RUN_CMD`/`TEST_CMD`.
